title: Artist at work: five British sculptors work and talk (TEFC)
creator_credit: Forma Arts Associates and Warren Forma
brief_description: Shows five British sculptors as they work in their studios and discuss their achievements: Barbara Hepworth, who made the centerpiece for the exterior circle of the United Nations Headquarters in New York; Kenneth Armitage, who made “Mouton sun” for Chateau Mouton Rothschild; Lyn Chadwick, who won first prize in 1959 at Padua; Reg Butler, who won grand prize for his monument of the unknown political prisoner in 1953; Henry Moore, who completed the centerpieces for the Lincoln Centre for the Performing Arts in New York.
